mdRecord.dcterms:title: Wilhelm C. Von Roentgen medallion
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The medallion was made to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the discovery of X-rays by Wilhelm C. Von Rontgen (1845-1923). The medallion measures 2 cm x 3.8 cm x 3.8 cm. The back of the medallion reads "Roentgen Rays; An image of the invisible; discovered November 8 1895; One oz. .999 fine silver." It is encased in plastic and contained in a blue velvet-lined box. This item was given in honor of Theodore E. Keats, M.D., F.A.C.R., Chair of the UVa Department of Radiology from 1963-1991.
